CometVisu.name: CometVisu

constructors.description: Class that handles the communicaton of the client

appendCanvas.description: Append to the jQuery element a canvas element and return it.

readResendHeaderValues.description: read the header values of a response and stores them to the resendHeaders array

handleSession.description: This function gets called once the communication is established and session information is available

doRecolorNonTransparent.description:
Do the recoloring based on @param thisIcon and store it in the 
hash @param thisIconColors.

handleError.description:
This function gets called on an error
FIXME: this should be a prototype, so that the application developer can override it

stop.description: This function stops an ongoing connection

handleRead.description: This function gets called once the communication is established and session information is available

subscribe.description:
Subscribe to the addresses in the parameter
The second parameter (filter) is optional

includeScripts.description:
Include files on this place. This will be replaced by the content of the
script during packaging

beforeSend.description: manipulates the header of the current ajax query before it is been send to the server

buildRequest.description: Build the URL part that contains the addresses and filters

watchdog.description: The watchdog to recreate a read request when it stopped somehow

login.description:
This function starts the communication by a login and then runs the
ongoing communication task

recolorNonTransparent.description:
Funtion to call for each icon that should be dynamically recolored.
This will be called for each known URL, so only remember the string but
don't load the image yet as it might not be needed.

restart.description: Restart the read request, e.g. when the watchdog kicks in

fillCanvas.description:
Fill the canvas element @param c with the ImageData. Also resize the 
canvas at the same time.

ts.description:
ts is a quirk to fix wrong caching on some Android-tablets/Webkit;
could maybe selective based on UserAgent but isn't that costly on writes

innerRecolorLoop.description:
Two versions of a recoloring funtion to work around an Android bug:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14969496/html5-canvas-pixel-manipulation-problems-on-mobile-devices-when-setting-the-alph
https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=17565

CometVisu.description: Class that handles the communicaton of the client

icon.name: icon

constructors.description: The object "icon" contains the whole API necessary to handle the icons.

getAvailableWidth.description:
return the available width for a the currently visible page
the available width is calculated by subtracting the following elements widths (if they are visible) from the body width
- Left-Navbar
- Right-Navbar

return.description: the next value in the list (including wrap around).

getNextMappedValue.description: Look up the entry for @param value in the mapping @param this_map and

navbarSetSize.description:
Change the size of the selected navbar
currently only "left" and "right" are implemented

select.description: Set the selection state of a widget.

lookupWidget.description: Return a widget (to be precise: the widget_container) for the given path

getAvailableHeight.description:
return the available height for a the currently visible page
the available height is calculated by subtracting the following elements heights (if they are visible) from the window height
- Top-Navigation
- Top-Navbar
- Bottom-Navbar
- Statusbar
Notice: the former way to use the subtract the $main.position().top value from the total height leads to errors in certain cases
because the value of $main.position().top is not reliable all the time

write.description: Set all attributes of a widget.

applyColumnWidths.description: applies the correct width to the widgets corresponding to the given colspan setting

return.description: The URI for the icon - or "undefined" if not known

params.name: color
params.description: Color (optional, only relevant for monochrome icons)

get.description: Get the icon information for a name.

read.description: Return all attributes of a widget.

pluginLoaded.description: This has to be called by a plugin once it was loaded.

insert.description:
Insert or overwrite one or many icons into the database. The parameter
might be a full hash of icon definitions or a single one consisting out of
a name and a URI path. Optional further parameters are a "type" and a
flavour.

initializeNavbars.description:
traverse down the page tree from root page id_ -> .. -> page_id activate
all navbars in that path deactivate all others

return.description: List of all known icon names

getPluginDependency.description:
Load a script and run it before page setup.
This is needed for plugin that depend on an external library.

updatePageParts.description: update the visibility ob top-navigation, footer and navbar for this page

deleteCommand.description:
Delete an existing path, i.e. widget, group or even page - including 
child elements.

debug.description:
Return icon database for debuging purposes - use ONLY for debugging as it's
circumventing the data hiding and exposes a writeable reference to the
database object!

handleMessage.description:
Reflection API: communication
Handle messages that might be sent by the editor

pathRegEx.description:
Function to test if the path is in a valid form.
Note: it doesn't check if it exists!

db.description:
Internal database of the known icons.
Initially filled with the default icons.

icon.description: The object "icon" contains the whole API necessary to handle the icons.

CometVisu Client.description: The JavaScript library that implements the CometVisu protocol.
CometVisu Client.title: CometVisu Client
CometVisu Client.name: CometVisu Client
